comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Other Bain/LOC photos of Ivy Day (commencement day) at Barnard College, the sister college of Columbia University, June 7, 1911:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163478100/]
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163523756/]

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content:
Thank you Wystan and artolog for your comments on the dates of these images, which encouraged us to look at them more closely.  The above image and the two noted in Wystan's comment are from the same Barnard Ivy day celebration which took place in June 1911.

Take a look at the ivy plant under the columns and the woman in the white headband on the left who appears in the back of the crowd in all three images. 

The above image appears to show the class of 1913 holding a banner, standing across from the graduating class of 1911, who are in caps and gowns.
